title: kutnerALSM5e Appendix C Data Sets
text: primary object Study Efficiency Nosocomial Infection Control (SENIC Project (“SENIC Project” 1980)) determine whether infection surveillance control programs reduced rates nosocomial (hospital-acquired) infection United States hospitals. data set consists random sample 113 hospitals selected original 338 hospital surveyed. line data set identification number provides information 11 variable single hospital. data presented 1975-76 study period. 12 variables :
code: SENIC <-   read.table(     file = system.file("datasets", "APPENC01.txt", package = "kutnerALSM5e")   , header = FALSE   , col.names = c(       "id"     , "lenght_of_stay"     , "age"     , "infection_risk"     , "culturing_ratio"     , "chest_x_ray_ratio"     , "number_of_beds"     , "medical_school_affiliation"     , "region"     , "average_daily_census"     , "number_of_nurses"     , "available_facilities_and_services"     )   )
